title: Kryptowerk
author: Kryptowerk
created_time: December 05, 2022, 04:14:56 PMLast edit: December 26, 2022, 10:01:21 PM by Kryptowerk
content: E N T R Y Â  C L O S E D !________________________Free Raffle - Monero Special Christmas Edition  There will be three winners!1st prize (last block) 2019 Monero XMR 21.0 x 21.0 cm Kryptowerk postcard - funded with 0.25 XMR by Moonbits -- info: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5140464.02nd price (2nd block) 2018 Monero XMR 21.0 x 21.0 cm Kryptowerk postcard3rd prize (first block) set of two unreleased 2021 Monero XMR Kryptowerk postcardMore info: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5186966.0Terms- Account must have positive trade feedback or must be an established Hero / Legendary account (no negative trading feedback!)- I'll take the right to exclude anyone at my own discretion (will only do so with good reasoning: rude behaviour, obvious spamming etc.)- No multis - are going to be excluded from this and any raffles in the future.- If the prize is lost in transit, there will be no replacement- Shipping will be included worldwide!- Minimum of 7 received merits!- BONUS If you are in any way using your time and energy in a proofable positive way towards Monero (dev, promo, blog, vids, support in this forum or similar) you are free to enter, too.How can I participate?UPDATE! possibly 2x prizes!Quote from: Kryptowerk on December 07, 2022, 01:19:15 PMTo up the stakes (for myself) and for some extra excitement I'll give myself a slot in the raffle. #55If I hit a block, this prize will be doubled. Meaning we re-roll again, but giving out two prizes, rolling two blocks, instead of one.Example: 3rd prize (1st block) was already won by a participant. Now we are rolling for 2nd prize (2nd block). My entry is hit: Now we roll again, but twice, giving out two #2 prizes.Just pick any available number between 00-99! Please post in the following format: "YOUR NUMBER/SPOT - YOUR USERNAME"Once full, I'll pick a Bitcoin block that has not been mined yet. The last numbers of the block hash will determine the winner.
